sen.j: 和歌は私的に交わされる贈答歌が主となり、宮廷で詠まれることは奈良時代と比較すると少なくなった。
sen.e: Zotoka (poems exchanged between man and woman) became the leading style of Waka, and the number of Waka composed in the Imperial court decreased compared with that in the Nara era.

sen.e: However, in the middle of the Heian era, the decline of Tang and abolish of Kentoshi (embassy to Tang dynasty) lessened the influence of Chinese culture, and Kokufu bunka was developed.

sen.j: その過程で、仮名文字の発達とあいまって和歌は次第に公的な文化として復権し、歌合も行われるようになった。
sen.e: In its process, Waka gradually regained its position as an official culture along with the development of Kana characters (the Japanese syllabaries), and Uta awase (poetry match) came to be held.

sen.e: Keien School had been a leading School in the Tanka composers' society until the early Meiji era.

sen.j: 明治時代初期の歌壇は、御歌所派や桂園派などの江戸期からの伝統的な文化人たちが担ってきたが、和歌改革を志す人々（正岡子規や与謝野鉄幹ら）によって題詠による作歌・風雅な趣向が批判され、新時代に相応しい新しい和歌が生まれた。
sen.e: In the beginning of the Meiji era, highly educated people played important roles in the Tanka composers' society represented by Outadokoro School and Keien School, but people who intended Waka reform (Shiki MASAOKA, Tekkan YOSANO, and so on) criticized both style and elegant poetic devices of Daiei (poetry composed on a given theme), and new style of Waka which was suitable for the new era emerged.
sen.cmt: 題詠の訳語は「ル和」より
sen.e: In the beginning of the Meiji era, highly educated people played important roles in the Tanka Composers' Society represented by the Outadokoro School and Keien School, but people who intended Waka reform (Shiki MASAOKA, Tekkan YOSANO, and so on) criticized both style and elegant poetic devices of Daiei (poetry composed on a given theme), and thus there emerged a new style of Waka was suitable for the new era.

Highly educated people of the early Meiji period played important roles in the Tanka Composers' Society, as represented by the Outadokoro School and Keien School, but people who intended waka reform (Shiki MASAOKA, Tekkan YOSANO, and so on) criticized both the style and elegant poetic devices of daiei (poetry composed on a given theme), and thus there emerged a new style of waka suitable for the new era.

sen.j: しかし、伝統的な和歌と区別するために、やがてこれらの新しい歌は「短歌」と呼称するのが普通となった（短歌の項も参照のこと）。
sen.e: However, in order to discern the new Waka from the traditional one, these new poems came to be commonly called 'Tanka.' (see also Tanka)
However, in order to discern the new Waka from the traditional one, these new poems came to be commonly called "Tanka" (see also "Tanka").

tit.j: 和歌の西洋音楽による解釈
tit.e: Interpretation of Waka through Western music
Interpretation of Waka through Western music
Interpretation of Waka through Western music

sen.j: 和歌は、節（ふし）を付けて詠うものとして始まったため、節にのっていれば文字数（音節数・モーラ数）の規定はややゆるい。
sen.e: Because Waka began as a song sung to a tune, the number of letters (the number of syllable or mora) are not strictly confined if it is read in a singsong tone.
Because waka began as accompaniment to a tune, the number of letters (the number of syllables, or mora) is not strictly confined if it is read in a singsong manner.
Because waka began as accompaniment to a tune, the number of letters (the number of syllables, or mora) is not strictly confined if it is read in a singsong manner.

sen.j: すなわち、節にのっていれば、五音・七音以外の音節数であっても実質的には「字余り・字足らず」ではない。
sen.e: Therefore, as long as it is read in a singsong tone, the poem doesn't essentially seem to have 'extra syllables or insufficient syllables' even if it doesn't consist of 5 and 7 syllables.
Therefore, as long as it is read in a singsong tone, the poem doesn't essentially seem to have "extra syllables or insufficient syllables," even if it doesn't consist of five and seven syllables.

Therefore, as long as it is read in a singsong manner the poem doesn't essentially seem to have 'extra syllables or insufficient syllables,' even if it doesn't consist of lines with five and seven syllables.

sen.j: 「字余り・字足らず」という考え方は、詠うことよりも、書き留めた際の定型詩としての美意識から生まれた言葉である。
sen.e: The idea that 'extra or insufficient syllables' arose from a sense of beauty for a fixed form of verse to write down rather than to recite.
The idea that "extra or insufficient syllables" arose from a sense of beauty for a fixed form of verse to write down rather than to recite.
The idea of 'extra or insufficient syllables' arose from a sense of beauty for a fixed form of verse to write down instead of reciting it.

sen.j: 西洋音楽による解釈では、和歌はテンポの遅い四分の四拍子で、2小節で1セットのリズムを作っている。
sen.e: In explanation of Western music, Waka has slow quadruple time making its rhythm by a set of 2 bars.
In the context of Western music, waka has a slow quadruple time that establishes its rhythm in sets of two bars.
In the context of Western music, waka has a slow quadruple time that establishes its rhythm in sets of two bars.

sen.j: 五音は1リズム（2小節）に5つの四分音符と3つの四分休符、七音は1リズムに7つの四分音符と1つの四分休符を基本形としているが、四分音符・休符の総数が1リズム（2小節）内に8つであればよい（九音の場合、音節数が9なら三連符が一部入る）。
sen.e: 5 syllables consists of 5 crotchets and 3 crotchet rests in 1 rhythm (2 bars), and 7 syllables consists of 7 crotchets and 1 crotchet rest in 1 rhythm, but if the total number of crotchet and crotchet rest is 8 in 1 rhythm (2 bars), then it's fine. (9 syllables includes triplet partly.)

Five syllables consists of five crotchets and three crotchet rests in one rhythm (two bars), and seven syllables consists of seven crotchets and onecrotchet rest in one rhythm, but if the total number of crotchet and crotchet rest is eight in one rhythm (two bars), then it's fine (nine syllables includes a triplet part).

Five syllables consists of five crotchets and three crotchet rests in one rhythm (two bars), while seven syllables consists of seven crotchets and one crotchet rest in one rhythm, but if the total number of crotchets and crotchet rests is eight in one rhythm (two bars), then it is acceptable (nine syllables includes a triplet part).

sen.j: 歌体は、これらのリズムの組み合わせや数に依存する。
sen.e: A verse form depends on the combination and number of rhythm.
A verse form depends on the combination and number of the rhythm.
A verse form depends on the combination and number of the rhythm.

sen.j: 例えば、短歌は2小節1セットのリズムが5つで出来ており、全小節数は10となる。
sen.e: For example, Tanka is made up of 5 sets of 2 bars, and total number of bars is 10.
For example, Tanka is made up of five sets of two bars, and the total number of bars is ten.
For example, a Tanka is made up of five sets of two bars, giving a total number of ten bars.

sen.j: 「あきのたの かりほのいおの とまをあらみ わがころもでは つゆにぬれつつ」という短歌は、「五七六、七七」で字余りといわれるが、リズムごとに2小節ずつ区切ると、「あきのたが多用されたりする。
sen.e: The Tanka that 'Temporary hermitage, with straw mat on the roof, in autumn rice field.My cloth would be getting wet with rain.' is said to be divided into 2 parts of '5, 7, 6 and 7, 7,' having an extra syllable, but if the poem is divided by a set of 2 bars, 'Akinota (autumn rice field)' is used more.

The tanka, "temporary hermitage, with straw mat on the roof, in autumn rice field;my cloth would be getting wet with rain" is said to be divided into two parts of "five, seven, six and seven, seven," having an extra syllable, but if the poem is divided by a set of two bars, "Akinota (autumn rice field)" is preferred.

sen.j: 短歌を和歌の詠み方（リズム）から脱して西洋音楽化させた例として「君が代」があるが、この場合は上記のような短歌のリズムから脱し、西洋音楽として美しく聴こえるよう音節を長短させている。
sen.e: An example of applying Western style harmony to Tanka deserting the way of reciting Waka (rhythm) is 'Kimigayo (Japanese national anthem),' and in this case, the rhythm of Tanka stated above was abandoned, and it is adjusted to the Western harmony.

An example of applying Western-style harmony to tanka and deserting the manner of reciting waka (rhythm) is 'Kimigayo (the Japanese national anthem),' and in this case the rhythm of tanka, as stated above, was abandoned in the adjustment to the Western system of harmony.

sen.j: 一方、「荒城の月」は「七五、七五、…、七五」と繰り返される和歌であるが、和歌のリズムをあまり崩さずに西洋音楽に適合させた名曲である。
sen.e: On the other hand, 'Kojo no tsuki (the moon over the deserted castle)' is an excellent piece of music, which was applied to the Western style harmony without destroying the rhythm of Waka of 7 and 5 syllables.
